# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ¥‡-partners

## 1. Summary

This chat segment contains minimal technical discussion and primarily consists of link sharing and brief commentary. The conversation touches on three main topics:

**Regime Change Discussion**: Krippãƒˆãƒ¡ã‚¢ acknowledges a previous story about regime and world-order change use cases, noting these represent a "different beast" in terms of complexity or implementation challenges.

**Marketing and Organic Growth**: DorianD shares a LinkedIn post about OpenClaw/MoltBot AI, emphasizing the need for "organic" promotional content. This suggests a focus on authentic community-driven marketing rather than forced promotional efforts. DorianD also mentions billionaires having houses in New Zealand, though the context connecting this to the technical discussion is unclear.

**Eliza Attention Generation**: Broccolex shares a Twitter/X post from @joemccann, suggesting it could generate attention for Eliza (likely referring to an AI project or framework). This indicates ongoing efforts to increase visibility and adoption.

**Additional Link**: Kenk shares a Twitter/X post from @owocki without additional context.

The segment lacks substantive technical implementation details, code discussions, or problem-solving activities. It appears to be a partners channel focused on strategic positioning and visibility rather than hands-on development work.

## 2. FAQ

No meaningful technical questions with responses were present in this chat segment.

## 3. Help Interactions

No direct help interactions were identified in this chat segment.

## 4. Action Items

Type: Feature | Description: Generate organic promotional content similar to the OpenClaw/MoltBot AI LinkedIn post | Mentioned By: DorianD

Type: Feature | Description: Leverage Joe McCann's post to generate attention for Eliza project | Mentioned By: Broccolex

# Discord Channel Analysis: ðŸ’¬-coders

## 1. Summary

The channel discussion centered on several technical issues with ElizaOS/milaidy installations and plugin development. The most significant technical exchange involved **azsxdc** encountering multiple errors on a fresh VPS installation of milaidy, including a crash in the "agent_skill_instructions" provider where `skill.description.toLowerCase is not a function`. **Odilitime** confirmed this is a known bug requiring a fix. Two other errors were clarified as normal and ignorable: missing server ID for world and server ownership issues. A third warning about pluginRegistryService failing with 401 Unauthorized was identified as work-in-progress functionality.

**kira** inquired about wallet management plugins for openclaw, specifically for game skill integration with security considerations, but received no response. **Vega** announced development of a plugin to use SillyTavern character cards, promising to release it later. **Wes** questioned the need for Cardano wallet integration in ElizaOS. **DorianD** asked about submission to clawhub without context. **ElizaBAO** promoted their Colosseum Agent Hackathon project combining ElizaBAO + Claw with Polymarket signal scanning, x402/SOL paywall, and Moltbook autoposters. **s** mentioned existing WebSocket functionality via plugin/server.

The channel also contained spam/scam content that moderators acknowledged needing better autoban systems for.

## 2. FAQ

Q: What's the best wallet management plugin for openclaw? (asked by kira) A: Unanswered

Q: Are these errors normal on a fresh install on VPS for milaidy? (asked by azsxdc) A: Some are normal (server ID and ownership errors can be ignored), but the agent_skill_instructions crash is a bug that needs fixing, and the pluginRegistryService 401 error is WIP (answered by Odilitime)

Q: Could the error be because I've configured skillsmp? (asked by azsxdc) A: Unanswered

Q: Is there anyone looking for developer? (asked by C.C) A: Unanswered

Q: Can I see the roadmap? (asked by solsunmoon) A: Unanswered

Q: Do we need a way to integrate with Cardano with wallets in ElizaOS? (asked by Wes) A: Unanswered

Q: Has this been submitted to clawhub? (asked by DorianD) A: Unanswered

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: Odilitime | Helpee: azsxdc | Context: Multiple errors on fresh milaidy VPS installation including provider crash, server ID errors, and plugin registry failures | Resolution: Confirmed agent_skill_instructions crash is a known bug needing fix; clarified server ID and ownership errors are normal and ignorable; identified pluginRegistryService error as WIP feature

## 4. Action Items

Type: Technical | Description: Fix agent_skill_instructions provider crash where skill.description.toLowerCase is not a function in @elizaos/plugin-agent-skills | Mentioned By: Odilitime

Type: Technical | Description: Implement autoban system for scam support tickets | Mentioned By: azsxdc

Type: Feature | Description: SillyTavern character cards plugin for openclaw | Mentioned By: Vega

Type: Feature | Description: Cardano wallet integration for ElizaOS | Mentioned By: Wes

# Discord Chat Analysis - "core-devs" Channel

## 1. Summary

This chat segment contains minimal technical discussion. The conversation consists primarily of greeting messages ("gm" - good morning) exchanged between community members sam, SYMBiEX, and Stan. The only substantive content is a link shared by jin to a YouTube video titled "weekly roundup of elizaos updates." No technical problems were discussed, no solutions were proposed, and no development decisions were made during this time period. The chat represents casual community interaction rather than active development work.

## 2. FAQ

No significant technical questions were asked or answered in this chat segment.

## 3. Help Interactions

No help interactions occurred in this chat segment.

## 4. Action Items

Type: Documentation | Description: Review weekly roundup of elizaos updates video for potential documentation updates | Mentioned By: jin

# Discord Chat Analysis: ðŸ’¬-discussion

## 1. Summary

The discussion channel was dominated by community concerns about token price decline, exchange delistings, and perceived lack of team communication. The primary technical issue discussed was the Korean exchange delisting situation - there was significant confusion about whether ELIZAOS was being delisted from Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit. User gby claimed the delisting was confirmed and scheduled, while davidhq and paolin later clarified that only the pre-rebrand AI16Z token was delisted, not the current ELIZAOS token.

A critical migration issue emerged when user ufw discovered they had missed the ai16z to ELIZA token migration deadline, asking if their tokens were lost. This question went unanswered by team members.

Technical development updates were minimal but included: jin posting a weekly roundup video of ElizaOS updates, yojo providing feedback on elizacloud.ai UX optimization needs (suggesting prompt-only user features, visual generation optimization, plug-in marketplace, and crypto transfers without wallet connect), and Seppmos sharing a video covering Babylon and Hyperscape developments.

Community sentiment was largely negative, with multiple users (averma, gby, Gem Hunter) expressing concerns about: lack of token utility, team selling tokens (specifically Shaw's wallet DScqtGwFoDTme2Rzdjpdb2w7CtuKc6Z8KF7hMhbx8ugQ being monitored), developers leaving the project (CJ and another unnamed dev), and absence of admin/team presence in the channel. User ovo defended the team, noting Shaw covered unexpected costs to recover the X account and that the team burned 22M tokens. The discussion revealed deep frustration from token holders who felt the open-source development work wasn't translating to token value or holder benefits.

## 2. FAQ

Q: Where can I bridge eliza token from solana to bsc? (asked by clutch) A: There is currently NO official or safe bridge for Eliza from Solana to BSC (answered by EMERSON3S)

Q: Is $ELIZAOS going to be delisted from the 3 korean exchanges? (asked by avi_rajput563 | TABI ðŸ’¢) A: Conflicting responses - gby claimed delisting was confirmed and scheduled in 2 hours on Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit; davidhq and paolin later clarified only pre-rebrand AI16Z was delisted, not current ELIZAOS (answered by EMERSON3S initially saying "ignore the lies", then gby, davidhq, and paolin)

Q: What happens if I didn't migrate my original a16z tokens in time? (asked by ufw) A: Unanswered

Q: Is the support desk discord thing a scam? (asked by ufw) A: Yes it is (answered by Monsgroow.)

Q: What is the CA of this new Elizacoin? (asked by Convex Bit) A: Unanswered

Q: Is Shaw selling his elizaos tokens? (asked by gby) A: gby provided wallet address DScqtGwFoDTme2Rzdjpdb2w7CtuKc6Z8KF7hMhbx8ugQ claiming Shaw was selling; ovo and davidhq disputed this, asking for transaction IDs as proof (answered by ovo and davidhq)

Q: Why was this rugged? (asked by thorionpartners) A: Unanswered

Q: Where can we read about updates? (asked by Rainman) A: jin mentioned weekly roundup videos are posted, likely to a specific channel (answered by jin)

## 3. Help Interactions

Helper: EMERSON3S | Helpee: clutch | Context: User needed to bridge ELIZA from Solana to BSC | Resolution: Informed there is no official or safe bridge available

Helper: Monsgroow. | Helpee: ufw | Context: User asked if support desk discord was legitimate | Resolution: Confirmed it was a scam

Helper: gby | Helpee: avi_rajput563 | TABI ðŸ’¢ | Context: User needed clarity on Korean exchange delisting rumors | Resolution: Provided information that delisting was scheduled on Bithumb, Coinone, and Korbit (though later disputed)

Helper: davidhq | Helpee: gby | Context: Verification of delisting claims and Shaw's wallet activity | Resolution: Requested transaction IDs and links to verify claims, couldn't find selling transactions

Helper: paolin | Helpee: Community | Context: Confusion about ELIZAOS delisting from Bithumb | Resolution: Clarified that Bithumb delisted AI16Z (pre-rebrand), not ELIZAOS

Helper: jin | Helpee: Rainman | Context: User looking for project updates | Resolution: Directed to weekly roundup videos and mentioned jintern will post to dedicated channel

## 4. Action Items

Type: Feature | Description: Optimize elizacloud.ai UX for prompt-only (zero coding) users including visual generation optimization, refer-to-friends offers, external agent interaction options, and crypto transfers without wallet connect | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Feature | Description: Create certified/recommended plug-in-and-play section for elizacloud.ai to enable non-technical users to create use cases | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Feature | Description: Implement different up-selling packages for elizacloud.ai users who prefer not to search for plugins themselves | Mentioned By: yojo

Type: Documentation | Description: Clarify official position on Korean exchange delisting situation (AI16Z vs ELIZAOS) | Mentioned By: davidhq, paolin

Type: Documentation | Description: Provide clear communication about token migration deadline and options for users who missed it | Mentioned By: ufw

Type: Documentation | Description: Establish regular team updates and communication channels for token holders | Mentioned By: Gem Hunter, averma, Rainman

Type: Technical | Description: Post weekly ElizaOS update videos to dedicated channel using jintern | Mentioned By: jin

Type: Documentation | Description: Clarify token utility and use cases for token holders beyond open-source development | Mentioned By: averma
